content.raw: We were only going to merge once there was the ability to turn plugins on and off with a GUI - which  I was going to work on next but have been distracted with PyQt5 and Python3 :p. I'm sympathetic to merging it sooner, if there's demand, but I don't mind myself because the labs here are using a fork with a similar feature (also more hacky), and they won't switch to mainline until I get a few more features into mainline that the experiments rely on anyway. So for us there is no hurry until I get those few other features in.
